(3)(+0000009): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"IPAOuYfT", properties:{formattedCitation:"(2015)", plainCitation:"(2015)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:2025, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/CW57KEIV"], itemData:{id:2025, type:"thesis", abstract:"\u94F6\u53D1\u6D6A\u6F6E\u6C79\u6D8C\u800C\u81F3,21\u4E16\u7EAA\u662F\u8001\u9F84\u5316\u7684\u4E16\u7EAA\u3002\u4E2D\u56FD\u4E43\u81F3\u5168\u7403\u4EBA\u53E3\u7ED3\u6784\u7684\u8001\u5316\u5728\u76F8\u5F53\u957F\u7684\u65F6\u671F\u5185\u90FD\u662F\u4E0D\u53EF\u9006\u8F6C\u7684,\u4EBA\u53E3\u8001\u9F84\u5316\u5C06\u6210\u4E3A\u4EBA\u7C7B\u793E\u4F1A\u7684\u65B0\u5E38\u6001\u3002\u5065\u5EB7\u957F\u5BFF\u662F\u4EBA\u7C7B\u6587\u660E\u7684\u6807\u5FD7,\u5065\u5EB7\u53EF\u4EE5\u4F7F\u4EBA\u957F\u5BFF,\u4F46\u957F\u5BFF\u4E0D\u4E00\u5B9A\u5065\u5EB7\u3002\u6211\u4EEC\u9700\u8981\u5EF6\u957F\u7684\u662F\u201C\u5065\u5EB7\u5BFF\u547D\u201D,\u4F46\u662F\u76EE\u524D\u4E2D\u56FD\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u201C\u957F\u5BFF\u4E0D\u5065\u5EB7\u201D\u7684\u72B6\u51B5\u582A\u5FE7\u3002\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u662F\u53CD\u6620\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u751F\u6D3B\u72B6\u6001\u4E0E\u751F\u6D3B\u8D28\u91CF\u7684\u91CD\u8981\u65B9\u9762,\u5BF9\u4E8E\u4E24\u8005\u7684\u7814\u7A76\u53CA\u5176\u5173\u7CFB\u5747\u5B58\u5728\u4E89\u8BAE,\u6709\u5FC5\u8981\u8FDB\u4E00\u6B65\u6DF1\u5165\u7814\u7A76\u4E24\u8005\u4E4B\u95F4\u7684\u5173\u7CFB\u53CA\u5F71\u54CD\u56E0\u5B50,\u8FD9\u5BF9\u5B9E\u73B0\u79EF\u6781\u8001\u9F84\u5316\u3001\u6210\u529F\u8001\u9F84\u5316\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u8001\u9F84\u5316\u5177\u6709\u73B0\u5B9E\u610F\u4E49,\u4E5F\u5BF9\u63D0\u9AD8\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u751F\u547D\u8D28\u91CF\u6709\u91CD\u8981\u7684\u610F\u4E49\u3002\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u76F8\u5173\u5173\u7CFB\u5DF2\u7ECF\u6709\u4E0D\u5C11\u7684\u7814\u7A76\u3002\u7814\u7A76\u53D1\u73B0,\u5065\u5EB7\u662F\u5F71\u54CD\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u91CD\u8981\u56E0\u7D20,\u540C\u65F6\u4E5F\u6709\u7814\u7A76\u53D1\u73B0\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u5F71\u54CD\u5065\u5EB7\u72B6\u51B5,\u5373\u4E24\u8005\u53EF\u80FD\u5B58\u5728\u4E92\u4E3A\u56E0\u679C\u7684\u5173\u7CFB\u3002\u4F46\u7531\u4E8E\u4EE5\u5F80\u7684\u7814\u7A76\u5927\u591A\u57FA\u4E8E\u6A2A\u622A\u9762\u8C03\u67E5\u6570\u636E,\u4E3B\u8981\u63ED\u793A\u4E86\u4E24\u8005\u7684\u76F8\u5173\u5173\u7CFB,\u96BE\u4EE5\u786E\u5B9A\u662F\u5426\u5B58\u5728\u56E0\u679C\u8054\u7CFB,\u5C1A\u6CA1\u6709\u5BF9\u4E24\u8005\u4E4B\u95F4\u53EF\u80FD\u5B58\u5728\u7684\u4E92\u4E3A\u56E0\u679C\u5173\u7CFB\u53CA\u5F71\u54CD\u56E0\u5B50\u8FDB\u884C\u6DF1\u5165\u5206\u6790\u3002\u672C\u6587\u5728\u5BF9\u56FD\u5185\u5916\u6709\u5173\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u6587\u732E\u8FDB\u884C\u7EFC\u8FF0\u7684\u57FA\u7840\u4E0A,\u5E94\u7528\u5317\u4EAC\u5927\u5B66\u5F00\u5C55\u7684\u5168\u56FD\u5927\u578B\u8C03\u67E5\u201C\u4E2D\u56FD\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u5065\u5EB7\u957F\u5BFF\u5F71\u54CD\u56E0\u7D20\u8C03\u67E5\u201D(CLHLS)2002-2011\u5E74\u7684\u7EB5\u5411\u6570\u636E,\u7ED3\u5408\u672C\u4EBA\u7684\u5B9A\u6027\u8BBF\u8C08\u8D44\u6599,\u91C7\u7528\u5B9A\u91CF\u548C\u5B9A\u6027\u5206\u6790\u76F8\u7ED3\u5408\u7684\u7814\u7A76\u65B9\u6CD5,\u5BF9\u4E2D\u56FD\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u72B6\u51B5\u4E0E\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u5173\u7CFB\u53CA\u5F71\u54CD\u56E0\u5B50\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u76F8\u4E92\u5F71\u54CD\u7684\u5185\u5728\u673A\u5236\u8FDB\u884C\u4E86\u6DF1\u5165\u7814\u7A76\u3002\u672C\u6587\u7814\u7A76\u5206\u4E3A\u7406\u8BBA\u6846\u67B6\u3001\u5B9E\u8BC1\u5206\u6790\u548C\u7406\u8BBA\u603B\u7ED3\u4E09\u4E2A\u90E8\u5206\u3002\u7406\u8BBA\u6846\u67B6\u4E3B\u8981\u56DE\u987E\u4E0E\u8BC4\u8FF0\u4EE5\u5F80\u7814\u7A76\u6210\u679C,\u63D0\u51FA\u672C\u6587\u7814\u7A76\u7684\u7406\u8BBA\u57FA\u7840\u548C\u5206\u6790\u6846\u67B6\uFF1B\u5B9E\u8BC1\u5206\u6790\u91C7\u7528\u5B9A\u91CF\u4E0E\u5B9A\u6027\u76F8\u7ED3\u5408\u7684\u65B9\u6CD5\u7814\u7A76\u4E2D\u56FD\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u72B6\u51B5\u3001\u5F71\u54CD\u56E0\u7D20,\u4EE5\u53CA\u4E0E\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u5173\u7CFB,\u89E3\u91CA\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u4E92\u76F8\u5F71\u54CD\u7684\u673A\u5236\u7B49\uFF1B\u7406\u8BBA\u603B\u7ED3\u4E3B\u8981\u6982\u62EC\u5168\u6587\u7684\u7814\u7A76\u7ED3\u8BBA,\u5E76\u5BF9\u7814\u7A76\u6210\u679C\u5C55\u5F00\u5173\u8054\u6027\u8BA8\u8BBA,\u6700\u540E\u63D0\u51FA\u653F\u7B56\u542F\u793A\u3002\u672C\u6587\u7684\u7814\u7A76\u7ED3\u8BBA\u4E3B\u8981\u5305\u62EC\uFF1A1.\u4E2D\u56FD\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u5B58\u5728\u4E92\u4E3A\u56E0\u679C\u5173\u7CFB\u3002\u672C\u6587\u91C7\u7528\u591A\u6C34\u5E73\u6A21\u578B\u548C\u4E8B\u4EF6\u53F2\u5206\u6790\u7B49\u7814\u7A76\u65B9\u6CD5,\u5728\u4E00\u4E2A\u7814\u7A76\u6846\u67B6\u4E2D\u5206\u522B\u5C06\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u4F5C\u4E3A\u56E0\u53D8\u91CF,\u76F8\u5E94\u5730,\u5065\u5EB7\u548C\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u5206\u522B\u4F5C\u4E3A\u81EA\u53D8\u91CF\u6765\u5206\u6790\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u4E4B\u95F4\u7684\u5173\u7CFB\u3002\u7814\u7A76\u53D1\u73B0,\u5728\u63A7\u5236\u793E\u4F1A\u4EBA\u53E3\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u7ECF\u6D4E\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u652F\u6301\u53D8\u91CF\u7684\u60C5\u51B5\u4E0B,\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u4E24\u4E2A\u7EF4\u5EA6\u6587\u5316\u7EC4\u7EC7\u6D3B\u52A8\u548C\u5BB6\u4E8B\u4E2A\u4EBA\u6D3B\u52A8\u4E0E\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u5173\u7CFB\u5448\u4E00\u81F4\u6027\u3002\u5065\u5EB7\u72B6\u51B5\u8F83\u597D,\u5219\u6587\u5316\u7EC4\u7EC7\u6D3B\u52A8\u548C\u5BB6\u4E8B\u4E2A\u4EBA\u6D3B\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u6C34\u5E73\u8F83\u9AD8\uFF1B\u6587\u5316\u7EC4\u7EC7\u6D3B\u52A8\u548C\u5BB6\u4E8B\u4E2A\u4EBA\u6D3B\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u6C34\u5E73\u8F83\u9AD8,\u5219\u5065\u5EB7\u72B6\u51B5\u8F83\u597D,\u6B7B\u4EA1\u98CE\u9669\u8F83\u4F4E\uFF1B\u5373\u4E2D\u56FD\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u4E4B\u95F4\u5B58\u5728\u4E92\u4E3A\u56E0\u679C\u7684\u5173\u7CFB\u30022.\u6587\u5316\u7EC4\u7EC7\u6D3B\u52A8\u548C\u5BB6\u4E8B\u4E2A\u4EBA\u6D3B\u52A8\u968F\u65F6\u95F4\u52A8\u6001\u53D8\u5316\u7684\u8D8B\u52BF\u5448\u4E00\u81F4\u6027,\u4F46\u4E0B\u964D\u7684\u901F\u7387\u4E0D\u540C\u3002\u7814\u7A76\u7ED3\u679C\u663E\u793A,\u65E0\u6761\u4EF6\u6A21\u578B\u65F6,\u4E24\u79CD\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u6D3B\u52A8\u5747\u5448\u52A8\u6001\u4E0B\u964D\u8D8B\u52BF,\u6574\u4F53\u53C2\u4E0E\u6C34\u5E73\u63A5\u8FD1,\u4F46\u5728\u63A7\u5236\u793E\u4F1A\u4EBA\u53E3\u3001\u5065\u5EB7\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u7ECF\u6D4E\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u652F\u6301\u8BF8\u591A\u53D8\u91CF\u540E,\u5065\u5EB7\u8F83\u5DEE\u7684\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA,\u6587\u5316\u7EC4\u7EC7\u6D3B\u52A8\u548C\u5BB6\u4E8B\u4E2A\u4EBA\u6D3B\u52A8\u5747\u5448\u73B0\u7565\u5FAE\u4E0A\u5347\u7684\u8D8B\u52BF,\u6587\u5316\u7EC4\u7EC7\u6D3B\u52A8\u6BD4\u5BB6\u4E8B\u4E2A\u4EBA\u6D3B\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u6C34\u5E73\u66F4\u4F4E,\u6587\u5316\u7EC4\u7EC7\u6D3B\u52A8\u6BD4\u5BB6\u4E8B\u4E2A\u4EBA\u6D3B\u52A8\u4E0B\u964D\u7684\u901F\u7387\u66F4\u5927\u30023.\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u52A8\u6001\u8D8B\u52BF\u53CA\u4E24\u8005\u5173\u7CFB\u53D7\u591A\u7EF4\u5EA6\u7EFC\u5408\u6307\u6807\u7684\u5F71\u54CD,\u5B58\u5728\u4E2A\u4F53\u5DEE\u5F02\u3002\u7814\u7A76\u53D1\u73B0,\u5BA2\u89C2\u4E0A\u7684\u5065\u5EB7\u6307\u6807\u3001\u4E3B\u89C2\u4E0A\u7684\u81EA\u8BC4\u5065\u5EB7\u6307\u6807\u5BF9\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u3001\u65E5\u5E38\u751F\u6D3B\u81EA\u7406\u80FD\u529B(ADL)\u548C\u6B7B\u4EA1\u98CE\u9669\u6709\u4E0D\u540C\u7A0B\u5EA6\u7684\u5F71\u54CD\u3002\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u72B6\u51B5\u6574\u4F53\u4E0A\u5448\u4E0B\u964D\u8D8B\u52BF,\u5747\u5B58\u5728\u663E\u8457\u7684\u4E2A\u4F53\u5DEE\u5F02,\u5F71\u54CD\u4E24\u8005\u5173\u7CFB\u7684\u4E3B\u5BFC\u56E0\u7D20\u793E\u4F1A\u4EBA\u53E3\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u7ECF\u6D4E\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u652F\u6301\u56E0\u7D20\u4E5F\u4E0D\u5C3D\u76F8\u540C\u3002\u5728\u63A7\u5236\u793E\u4F1A\u4EBA\u53E3\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u7ECF\u6D4E\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u652F\u6301\u53D8\u91CF\u7684\u60C5\u51B5\u4E0B,\u5065\u5EB7\u8F83\u5DEE\u7684\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA,\u7531\u4E8E\u57FA\u671F\u53C2\u4E0E\u6C34\u5E73\u8F83\u4F4E,9\u5E74\u89C2\u6D4B\u671F\u5185\u6587\u5316\u7EC4\u7EC7\u6D3B\u52A8\u548C\u5BB6\u4E8B\u4E2A\u4EBA\u6D3B\u52A8\u7684T\u503C\u5448\u73B0\u7565\u5FAE\u4E0A\u5347\u7684\u8D8B\u52BF\uFF1B\u540C\u65F6,\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u8F83\u4F4E\u7684\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA,\u7531\u4E8E\u57FA\u671F\u7684ADL\u72B6\u51B5\u8F83\u5DEE,\u89C2\u6D4B\u671F\u5185ADL\u7684T\u503C\u5448\u73B0\u7565\u5FAE\u4E0B\u964D\u7684\u8D8B\u52BF(ADL\u72B6\u51B5\u7565\u5FAE\u53D8\u597D\u7684\u8D8B\u52BF)\uFF1B\u5FC3\u7406\u5065\u5EB7\u5BF9\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u8EAB\u4F53\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u91CD\u8981\u6027\u51F8\u663E\u30024.\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u5728\u4E24\u8005\u7684\u56E0\u679C\u5173\u7CFB\u4E2D\u5177\u6709\u4E0D\u540C\u6548\u5E94\u3002\u5065\u5EB7\u5BF9\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u5F71\u54CD\u8868\u73B0\u4E3A\u9009\u62E9\u6027\u6548\u5E94,\u5373\u5065\u5EB7\u72B6\u51B5\u8F83\u597D\u7684\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u66F4\u591A\u5730\u9009\u62E9\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E,\u968F\u7740\u65F6\u95F4\u7684\u63A8\u79FB,\u60A3\u6162\u75C5\u7B49\u5065\u5EB7\u8F83\u5DEE\u7684\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u53C2\u4E0E\u5BB6\u4E8B\u4E2A\u4EBA\u6D3B\u52A8\u7684\u4E0B\u964D\u901F\u7387\u6162\u4E8E\u6587\u5316\u7EC4\u7EC7\u6D3B\u52A8,\u6D3B\u52A8\u7C7B\u578B\u5B58\u5728\u8F83\u4E3A\u660E\u663E\u7684\u9009\u62E9\u503E\u5411\u6027\u3002\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u5BF9\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u5F71\u54CD\u8868\u73B0\u4E3A\u4FC3\u8FDB\u6548\u5E94,\u5373\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u4FC3\u8FDB\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u8EAB\u5FC3\u5065\u5EB7\u6539\u5584\u4E0E\u751F\u6D3B\u8D28\u91CF\u7684\u63D0\u9AD8\uFF1B\u5F71\u54CD\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u56E0\u7D20\u4E5F\u4F1A\u4E0D\u540C\u7A0B\u5EA6\u5730\u5F71\u54CD\u5065\u5EB7\u30025.\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u8868\u73B0\u4E3A\u624B\u6BB5\u548C\u76EE\u7684\u7684\u5173\u7CFB\u3002\u672C\u6587\u91C7\u7528\u5B9A\u6027\u8BBF\u8C08\u6CD5\u5BF9\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u5F71\u54CD\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u673A\u5236,\u4EE5\u53CA\u5065\u5EB7\u5F71\u54CD\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u673A\u5236\u8FDB\u884C\u4E86\u6DF1\u5165\u7684\u7814\u7A76,\u7814\u7A76\u7ED3\u679C\u663E\u793A,\u5065\u5EB7\u662F\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u6700\u91CD\u8981\u76EE\u7684,\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u662F\u4FC3\u8FDB\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u91CD\u8981\u624B\u6BB5\u3002\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u4E3B\u8981\u662F\u901A\u8FC7\u6D3B\u52A8\u76F4\u63A5\u5F71\u54CD\u8EAB\u4F53,\u901A\u8FC7\u5F71\u54CD\u7ECF\u6D4E\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u5173\u7CFB\u3001\u5FC3\u7406\u4E0E\u7CBE\u795E\u72B6\u6001\u7B49\u8FDB\u800C\u95F4\u63A5\u5F71\u54CD\u5065\u5EB7\u3002\u8FD9\u4E5F\u8FDB\u4E00\u6B65\u9610\u91CA\u4E86\u60A3\u6709\u6162\u75C5\u7684\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u6587\u5316\u7EC4\u7EC7\u6D3B\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u6C34\u5E73\u8F83\u9AD8\u7684\u5B9A\u91CF\u5206\u6790\u7ED3\u679C\u3002\u672C\u7814\u7A76\u7684\u521B\u65B0\u4E4B\u5904\u5728\u4E8E\uFF1A1.\u57FA\u4E8E\u5168\u56FD\u5927\u578B\u7EB5\u5411\u8C03\u67E5\u7684\u622A\u9762\u6570\u636E\u548C\u7EB5\u5411\u6570\u636E,\u7ED3\u5408\u5B9A\u6027\u8C03\u67E5\u8D44\u6599,\u901A\u8FC7\u6DF1\u5165\u7814\u7A76\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u4E24\u4E2A\u7EF4\u5EA6\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u5404\u4E2A\u7EF4\u5EA6\u4E4B\u95F4\u7684\u5173\u7CFB,\u5728\u8FDB\u4E00\u6B65\u8BBA\u8BC1\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u5B58\u5728\u76F8\u5173\u5173\u7CFB\u7684\u57FA\u7840\u4E0A,\u6DF1\u5165\u5730\u8BBA\u8BC1\u4E86\u4E2D\u56FD\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u4E4B\u95F4\u7684\u4E92\u4E3A\u56E0\u679C\u5173\u7CFB\u30022.\u5BF9\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u4E92\u4E3A\u56E0\u679C\u5173\u7CFB\u7684\u5F71\u54CD\u673A\u5236\u8FDB\u884C\u4E86\u6DF1\u5165\u7814\u7A76\u3002\u901A\u8FC7\u5B9A\u91CF\u7814\u7A76\u65B9\u6CD5,\u53D1\u73B0\u4E86\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u5728\u4E24\u8005\u7684\u56E0\u679C\u5173\u7CFB\u4E2D\u5177\u6709\u4E0D\u540C\u6548\u5E94\uFF1B\u901A\u8FC7\u5B9A\u6027\u7814\u7A76\u65B9\u6CD5,\u53D1\u73B0\u4E86\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u4E92\u76F8\u5F71\u54CD\u7684\u4E0D\u540C\u673A\u5236,\u5065\u5EB7\u548C\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u662F\u76EE\u7684\u4E0E\u624B\u6BB5\u7684\u5173\u7CFB\u30023.\u5BF9\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u5173\u7CFB\u7684\u7814\u7A76\u65B9\u6CD5\u8FDB\u884C\u4E86\u65B0\u7684\u63A2\u7D22\u3002\u672C\u6587\u5C06\u591A\u6C34\u5E73\u6A21\u578B\u3001Cox\u7B49\u6BD4\u4F8B\u98CE\u9669\u6A21\u578B\u3001\u5B9A\u6027\u8BBF\u8C08\u6CD5\u4E0E\u89C2\u5BDF\u6CD5\u6709\u673A\u7ED3\u5408,\u591A\u7EF4\u5EA6\u591A\u89C6\u89D2\u6DF1\u5165\u63A2\u8BA8\u4E86\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u5173\u7CFB\uFF1B\u5148\u786E\u4FDD\u53D8\u91CF\u4E4B\u95F4\u65F6\u95F4\u4E0A\u7684\u201C\u524D\u56E0\u540E\u679C\u201D,\u8FD9\u6837\u540C\u65F6\u8003\u5BDF\u53D8\u5316\u4E0E\u4E8B\u4EF6\u53D1\u751F,\u6392\u9664\u4E86\u201C\u53CD\u5411\u56E0\u679C\u5173\u7CFB\u201D(\u5373\u5185\u751F\u6027\u95EE\u9898),\u4ECE\u800C\u8BC1\u660E\u4E86\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u5065\u5EB7\u4E0E\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u662F\u5148\u56E0\u540E\u679C,\u4EE5\u53CA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u540C\u6837\u4E5F\u662F\u5148\u56E0\u540E\u679C\u7684\u4E92\u4E3A\u56E0\u679C\u5173\u7CFB\u3002\u672C\u6587\u7684\u4E0D\u8DB3\u4E4B\u5904\u5728\u4E8E\uFF1A\u672A\u6DF1\u5165\u63A2\u8BA8\u5F71\u54CD\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u548C\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u4E0D\u53EF\u89C2\u6D4B\u7684\u5F02\u8D28\u6027,\u672A\u5BF9\u6A2A\u5411\u7684\u7701\u7EA7\u533A\u57DF\u7684\u5DEE\u5F02\u8FDB\u884C\u5206\u5C42\u5206\u6790\u3002", (4)(+0000001): Checking attachment file for item 1/HFEBLKQD

(3)(+0000020): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"yILg9yBI", properties:{formattedCitation:"(2016)", plainCitation:"(2016)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:1763, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/V54HUJCE"], itemData:{id:1763, type:"thesis", abstract:"ObjectiveThe purpose of this study is to investigate the status of quality of life and participation of social development as well as related factors in rural elders in Anhui province. Meanwhile, the relationship between quality of life and participation of social development is our concern too. In order to provide the foundation and reference for promoting the participation of social development to improve quality of life in rural elderly as well as suggestions and advices for coping successful aging.MethodsIn our study, we used quantitative research and qualitative interview simultaneously. In the stage of quantitative research, multi-stage stratified cluster sampling method was used. 2686 participators from 19 administrative villages were survived by questionnaires. Finally, 2642 questionnaires were collected. The effective rate is 98.4%. General information, health status and status of participation of social development were collected by questionnaires and physical examination. The quality of life and social support were assessed using Short-Form Health Survey\uFF08SF-36\uFF09 and Social Support Rate Scale\uFF08SSRS\uFF09. From qualitative research, 58 older adults in the selected areas were surveyed and 25 persons in charge of aging institutions were connected and talked about. In the stage of qualitative research, the current situation of aging institutions, the need of older adults and barrier of working were collected from older adults and persons in charge of aging institutions. The data were entered using Epi Data3.1 and analyzed with Statistical Product and Service Solution\uFF08SPSS\uFF09 version 16.0. All study variables were performed with a descriptive analysis. Quantitative variables were described as mean \xB1 standard deviation of mean, whereas categorical variables were expressed as frequencies. Binary logistic regression was used for category variables; multiple linear regression analysis was used for continuity variables. Correlation analysis adopted Pearson analysis. In this study, differences with a p value less than 0.05 were considered statistically significant.ResultsThe scores of eight subscales of quality of life are presented below. 67.74\xB125.54, 53.10\xB149.10, 66.96\xB125.07, 46.59\xB118.99, 67.78\xB115.03, 74.16\xB117.45, 60.47\xB148.35 and 70.30\xB114.72 are observed for subscales those are physical function, role-physical, body pain, general health, vitality, social function, role-emotional and mental health. The total scores of physical health and mental health are 58.60\xB122.75 and 68.18\xB118.73 respectively. The results from logistic regression show that gender, age, educational level, marital status, living status, number of children, disposable income and social support are factors associated with quality of life in the rural older adults.The status of rural elders is presented below. There are 1021 elders\uFF0838.6%\uFF09 have no job. The proportion of elders those who haven\u2019t participated volunteer activity is 98.6%. There are 1967\uFF0874.5%\uFF09 elders participated no community activities. The engagement of social and cultural activities is enjoyable and the highest engagement is discussing of family affairs\uFF0860.1%\uFF09. The highest engagement of leisure-time activities is chatting with friends\uFF0880.1%\uFF09. There are 54% older adults connect with friends or relatives one to two times a month and 51.2% close contacts with neighbors. Most elders\uFF0865.4%\uFF09 go outside less than once a week. The results from logistic regression of social participation indicate that old age and higher disposable income associated with lower social participation. However, well health status, high educational level, unmarried status and high social support have a positive relationship with social participation for elders.The correlation analysis shows that participation of social development has positive relationship with quality of life that is high level of participation of social development indicated well quality of life.ConclusionsThe quality of life for rural elders is not very well. The main related factors with quality of life are gender, age, educational level, marital status, health status, and living status, number of children, disposable incomes and social support. The participation of social development is relatively low in rural areas, especially the participation of non-economic activities. Potential factors associated with social participation are age, health status, educational level, and marital status, disposable income and social support. Meanwhile, promotion the participation of social development of rural elders could improve the quality of rural elders.", archive:"\u2605\u2605\u2605\u2605\u2605", genre:"\u7855\u58EB", (3)(+0000010): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"r43GjxZw", properties:{formattedCitation:"(2019)", plainCitation:"(2019)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:1601, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/XNHPH8X6"], itemData:{id:1601, type:"thesis", abstract:"Social participation includes both social interactions and productive activities of individuals in intimate social relationships.Through establishing connections with relatives,friends and the society,as well as participating in social interactions,senior people could meet their own needs,the expectations of the family and the society,and achieve \"something for the old\".Social participations also increase subjective well-being and lead to a fulfilling life in old age.The self-aging attitude is defined as the old people\u2019s positive or negative evaluations of the old people and themselves in the aging process.Self-aging attitude has an important impact on the physical and mental health and behaviors of the elderly.Research have supported the Dual Attitude Model and proposed that implicit and explicit aging attitudes to be psychological structures that are independent from each other\uFF08Devine,1989;Greenwald,1995;Wilson,Lindsey& Schooler,2000\uFF09.Liu & Sang\uFF082010\uFF09proposed that implicit attitude and explicit attitude have different powers in predicting different behaviors.The current study recruited the elderly over 60 years old as the research object,and utilized both behavioral experiment and questionnaire survey to explore the influence of the elderly\u2019s self-aging attitudes on social participation and the psychological mechanism.In study 1,the relationship between implicit and explicit aging attitudes and the predictive power of implicit aging attitudes on social participation were investigated by using questionnaire and behavior experiment.Twenty-eight subjects completed single category implicit association test\uFF08SC-IAT\uFF09,the attitude toward aging questionnaire,the social self-efficacy questionnaire and the geriatric social participation questionnaire.Results showed that implicit aging attitude was not related to explicit self-aging attitude,and implicit aging attitude was not related to social self-efficacy and social participation.In study 2,questionnaire survey was used to investigate the effect of explicit self-aging attitude on social participation,and the mediating effect betweenexplicit self-aging attitude and social participation.166 subjects completed the attitudes toward aging questionnaire,the social self-efficacy questionnaire and the social participation questionnaire for the elderly.Results showed that the elderly\u2019s explicit self-aging attitude could significantly predicted social participation,and the more positive the explicit self-aging attitude was,the higher the level of social participation was.Social self-efficacy mediated the relationship between self-aging attitude and social participation.Overall,findings of the current study indicated that:\uFF081\uFF09there is no correlation between implicit and explicit aging attitudes in the elderly;\uFF082\uFF09explicit self-aging attitude can positively predict social participation.The more positive explicit self-aging attitude is,the higher the level of social participation will be.\uFF083\uFF09social self-efficacy plays a mediating role between explicit aging attitude and social participation.", archive:"\u2605\u2605\u2605\u2605\u2605", (3)(+0000015): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"zwXzhDZF", properties:{formattedCitation:"(2013)", plainCitation:"(2013)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:773, abstract:"\u9AD8\u9F84\u793E\u4F1A\u5373\u5C06\u6765\u4E34,\u52A0\u4E0A\u63D0\u65E9\u9000\u4F11\u7684\u60C5\u51B5,\u53F0\u6E7E\u9AD8\u9F84\u8005\u9000\u4F11\u751F\u6DAF\u8F6C\u6362\u7684\u5386\u7A0B\u662F\u503C\u5F97\u63A2\u7A76\u7684\u8BAE\u9898\u3002\u4EE5\u8D28\u6027\u7814\u7A76\u7684\u65B9\u6CD5,\u9488\u5BF930\u4F4D\u6210\u529F\u8001\u5316\u8005\u8FDB\u884C\u534A\u7ED3\u6784\u5F0F\u7684\u8BBF\u8C08,\u5176\u76EE\u7684\u662F\u8981\u4E86\u89E3\u4ED6\u4EEC\u9000\u4F11\u751F\u6DAF\u8F6C\u6362\u7684\u5386\u7A0B\u3002\u7814\u7A76\u7ED3\u679C:\u53D7\u8BBF\u8005\u5728\u9000\u4F11\u524D\u7684\u671F\u5F85\u4E0E\u62C5\u5FE7,\u4F1A\u5F62\u6210\u79EF\u6781\u89C4\u5212\u4E0E\u7F3A\u4E4F\u51C6\u5907\u4E24\u79CD\u4E0D\u540C\u7684\u53D6\u5411;\u9000\u4F11\u751F\u6DAF\u8F6C\u6362\u65F6\u671F\u7684\u9014\u5F84,\u5305\u62EC\u8BA1\u5212\u578B\u3001\u5EF6\u7EED\u578B\u4E0E\u91CD\u65B0\u8C03\u9002\u578B;\u9000\u4F11\u751F\u6DAF\u7684\u7A33\u5B9A\u671F,\u6DB5\u76D6\u751F\u7406\u5065\u5EB7\u3001\u5FC3\u7406\u5B89\u9002\u3001\u6D3B\u8DC3\u7684\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u4EE5\u53CA\u7075\u6027\u5C42\u9762\u7684\u6210\u957F;\u5728\u7ECF\u5386\u9000\u4F11\u751F\u6DAF\u8F6C\u6362\u7684\u5386\u7A0B\u540E,\u53D7\u8BBF\u8005\u4EE5\u79EF\u6781\u8FDB\u53D6\u3001\u7EF4\u6301\u65E2\u6709\u7684\u751F\u6D3B\u65B9\u5F0F,\u4EE5\u53CA\u628A\u63E1\u65F6\u4E0B\u7B49\u4E09\u79CD\u65B9\u5F0F\u7EE7\u7EED\u672A\u6765\u7684\u9000\u4F11\u751F\u6DAF\u3002\u7814\u7A76\u7ED3\u679C\u53EF\u63D0\u4F9B\u9AD8\u9F84\u8005\u9000\u4F11\u751F\u6DAF\u8C03\u9002\u7684\u8C18\u5546\u4E0E\u8F85\u5BFC,\u4EE5\u53CA\u9AD8\u9F84\u5B66\u4E60\u6D3B\u52A8\u89C4\u5212\u7684\u53C2\u8003\u3002", 'container-title':"\u4EBA\u53E3\u7814\u7A76", ISSN:"1000-6087", issue:"5", language:"zh-CN", note:"<\u5317\u5927\u6838\u5FC3, CSSCI>", page:"49-63", source:"CNKI", title:"\u4E2D\u56FD\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u6A21\u5F0F\u53CA\u5176\u5BF9\u793E\u4F1A\u9002\u5E94\u7684\u5F71\u54CD", volume:"45", author:[{literal:"\u8C22\u7ACB\u9ECE"}, {literal:"\u738B\u98DE"}, {literal:"\u80E1\u5EB7"}], issued:{'date-parts':[["2021"]]}}}, {id:7950, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/2UH9ECPE"], itemData:{id:7950, type:"article-journal", abstract:"&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Social engagement has many benefits for health of older adults. The literature describes that personal and environmental factors may act as facilitators or obstacles for levels of social participation of older people. The objective of this systematic review was to examine social participation types most engaged among older people and to analyze factors influencing the social participation of these people. Published articles written in English from 2006 to 2016 were searched from electronic databases, including ScienceDirect, PubMed, and CINAHL databases. The keywords combination used in the search strategy were: social participation, social engagement, social activity, and factors, and aging, or older persons. Ten articles were selected for final review based on defined eligibility criteria.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The literature revealed that community-based activities were more engaged by older people than individual-based activities. In addition, factors influencing participation in social of older people were health status, and a friendly environment, whereas it was still unclear whether sociodemographic factors were correlated with participation in social of older people. The literature highlighted that more rigorous studies are needed to examine the correlation between factors and social participation of older people. Nurses need to work with others to support and educate significant people regarding friendly environments for older people so that they can engage in social activities, either community- based or individual-based.", 'container-title':"Pacific Rim International Journal of Nursing Research", ISSN:"2586-8373", issue:"2", language:"en-US", license:"Copyright (c) 2019 Pacific Rim International (3)(+0000044): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"n8vcmroY", properties:{formattedCitation:"(\\uc0\\u21340{}\\uc0\\u31077{}\\uc0\\u23071{}, 2017)", plainCitation:"(\u535C\u7965\u5A1F, 2017)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:4931, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/6S9EUIF8"], itemData:{id:4931, type:"thesis", abstract:"With the improvement of technology environment in China,the health of the elderly continues to improve,the elderly on the diversification of life after retirement,the level of demand has increased.On the one hand,in the elderly way of enriching the elderly,the spiritual level of demand makes some of the elderly hope that after retirement,through re-employment to achieve self-worth,is also in different stages of retirement,how to enrich the post-retirement life planning.Retired people have rich social experience,the job skills and expertise in the work of the advantages of young workers do not have,if we can make some of the conditions of the elderly through re-employment,re-enter the social production which can Give full play to the advantages of retirement experience,rich in the retirement life of the elderly at the same time,contribute to social development and more contributions.Retirement re-employment is not only an important direction for the development of the elderly in China,but also an effective channel to cope with the disappearance of China\u2019s hole dividend and the shortage of social labor resources.Re-employment of the elderly not only for social and business development to provide more help,but also the development of China\u2019s human resources component.Elderly people not only have a sense of old age,old age,but also a sense of worthiness,participate in social life at the same time enhance the understanding of self-worth,at the same time,its labor income can also help retirees and their families to improve Quality of life,and promote social harmony and development.However,The study found that in recent years,Linyi City,Shandong Province,the proportion of retired elderly employment has improved,and the proportion of male elderly employment to be significantly higher than the proportion of female elderly employment.The retired elderly are engaged in a wide range of occupations,mainly engaged in the production type of work,followed by the choice is engaged in business,service work,the third is as equipment operators,there are very few elderly people choose other employment channels.Re-employment channels for the retired persons there are six kinds,namely,through the introduction of friends and family,to participate in social recruitment,registration to find an intermediary position,job advertisements,self-employment or through other channels re-employment.The existing problems of reemployment of retirees in Linyi City mainly include social support insufficiency,unstable labor participation situation,backwardness of the old people,low utilization rate of the old human resources,low quality of the old manpower resources,comprehensive application of AHP and data statistic method.,The factors influencing the retirement and re-employment of the elderly were analyzed synthetically.The correlation values of physiological needs,safety requirements,attribution and love,respect for needs and self-actualization were 0.755,0.632,0.572,0.726,0.663,The paper puts forward the countermeasures and suggestions to improve the reemployment of the retirees in China,including the basic principles of employment for the aged,and the concept of retired reemployment must fully reflect the strategic goal orientation of the society,Enhance the subjective feelings of the elderly after re-employment and the realization of self-worth,improve the elderly re-employment mechanism,improve the education system for the elderly,the establishment of retired workers re-employment policy security system,the establishment of retired staff re-employment management services and a series of Measures.To the community to accept the re-employment of retirees,not only from the national policy to give retired employees re-employment development of the cause to protect,give the elderly policy support,but also from the whole society to give the elderly re-employment to support,only Social and retired people to understand each other,mutual recognition,in order to promote the development of retired re-employment,enhance their social status.With the development of society,the goal that people pursue is no longer \"live\" but to live better,more quality,the elderly is no exception,promote the reemployment of retirees to promote social and economic stability,high speed,sustainable development.", genre:"\u7855\u58EB", language:"zh-CN", publisher:"\u5357\u4EAC\u822A\u7A7A\u822A\u5929\u5927\u5B66", source:"CNKI", abstract:"\u76EE\u7684\u63A2\u8BA8\u6210\u90FD\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u4F4E\u9F84\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u52B3\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u884C\u4E3A\u53CA\u5F71\u54CD\u56E0\u7D20\u3002\u65B9\u6CD5\u62BD\u53D6\u6210\u90FD\u5E02\u91D1\u725B\u533A10\u4E2A\u8857\u9053273\u540D\u9000\u4F11\u4F4E\u9F84\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\uFF08\u5973\u602755\uFF5E64\u5C81,\u7537\u602760\uFF5E69\u5C81\uFF09\u5F00\u5C55\u52B3\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u884C\u4E3A\u76F8\u5173\u60C5\u51B5\u7684\u8C03\u67E5\u3002\u7ED3\u679C\u5728\u8C03\u67E5\u7684273\u540D\u9000\u4F11\u4F4E\u9F84\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u4E2D,\u6709\u7EA635.9%\u7684\u9000\u4F11\u4F4E\u9F84\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u4ECD\u7EE7\u7EED\u53C2\u4E0E\u52B3\u52A8\u3002\u6027\u522B\u3001\u5B66\u5386\u6C34\u5E73\u3001\u5DE5\u4F5C\u6280\u80FD\u804C\u79F0\u3001\u5C45\u4F4F\u65B9\u5F0F\u3001\u5B50\u5973\u4EE3\u9645\u7ECF\u6D4E\u652F\u6301\uFF08\u5BF9\u5B50\u5973\u7684\u4EE3\u9645\u7ECF\u6D4E\u652F\u6301\uFF09\u3001\u539F\u9000\u4F11\u5355\u4F4D\u7C7B\u578B\u3001\u9000\u4F11\u91D1\u6C34\u5E73,\u5BF9\u4F4E\u9F84\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u52B3\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u884C\u4E3A\u5177\u6709\u663E\u8457\u5F71\u54CD\uFF08P<0.05\uFF09\u3002\u7ED3\u8BBA\u5728\u4EBA\u53E3\u8001\u9F84\u5316\u95EE\u9898\u5DF2\u7ECF\u65E5\u76CA\u51F8\u663E\u7684\u80CC\u666F\u4E0B,\u5E94\u5F53\u9F13\u52B1\u9000\u4F11\u4F4E\u9F84\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u52B3\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u884C\u4E3A,\u63A8\u52A8\u5B9E\u73B0\u79EF\u6781\u8001\u9F84\u5316;\u5173\u6CE8\"\u7A7A\u5DE2\u8001\u4EBA\"\u95EE\u9898;\u63A8\u52A8\u8001\u5E74\u6559\u80B2\u4E8B\u4E1A\u7684\u53D1\u5C55;\u5EFA\u7ACB\u5F39\u6027\u9000\u4F11\u5236\u5EA6,\u7814\u7A76\u8BBA\u8BC1\u5EF6\u8FDF\u9000\u4F11\u5E74\u9F84\u653F\u7B56\u65B9\u6848\u3002", 'container-title':"\u4E2D\u56FD\u8001\u5E74\u5B66\u6742\u5FD7", ISSN:"1005-9202", issue:"23", language:"zh-CN", note:"<\u5317\u5927\u6838\u5FC3>", page:"5089-5092", source:"CNKI", title:"\u6210\u90FD\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u4F4E\u9F84\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u52B3\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u884C\u4E3A\u53CA\u5F71\u54CD\u56E0\u7D20", volume:"40", author:[{literal:"\u7A0B\u671D\u9633"}, {literal:"\u4E8E\u51CC\u4E91"}], issued:{'date-parts':[["2020"]]}}}, {id:5902, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/JTYZVVL2"], itemData:{id:5902, type:"thesis", abstract:"With the continuous development of China\u2019s economy and the continuous improvement of medical technology,the population mortality rate has been greatly reduced,the number of the elderly population in China has been rising,and the aging problem has shown an increasingly severe situation.As early as the millennium,the World Health Organization has put forward the concept of \"active aging\" to deal with the challenges of this century.The report of the Nineteenth National Congress of the Party also pointed out that we should actively deal with the aging of the population and improve the life satisfaction and happiness of the elderly groups.Encouraging and promoting the social participation of older persons is one of the effective ways to achieve their \"active ageing\" goals,through which older persons can have a greater sense of acquisition,happiness and security and make their retirement life more fulfilling,secure and sustainable.As a special group of the elderly,retired teachers in colleges and universities have their own unique value and advantages over the retired elderly in other industries.Active social participation is conducive to alleviating the contradiction between talent supply and demand;at the same time,it also brings great benefits to the elderly themselves,so that the elderly through the channel of social participation,give full play to their professional expertise,while contributing to the society,but also can achieve their own inner pursuit of a better life.This paper mainly focuses on the main line of social participation of retired teachers in colleges and universities,taking retired teachers in several colleges and universities in Anning District of Lanzhou City as the research object,through drawing on the theory of active aging and activity theory,combining with the characteristics of retired teachers\u2019 own social participation,with the help of questionnaire survey,literature research,statistical analysis and other methods to carry out empirical research on the social participation of retired teachers in colleges and universities in Anning District of Lanzhou City.It is found that there are a series of problems in the social participation of retired teachers in colleges and universities,such as imperfect legal mechanism,insufficient participation platform and low participation level.Based on this,this paper puts forward some countermeasures and suggestions on the socialparticipation of retired teachers in Anning District of Lanzhou City from different perspectives.In order to actively deal with aging,enhance the well-being of the elderly group,sense of acquisition,security to provide some reference and reference.", genre:"\u7855\u58EB", language:"zh-CN", note:"DOI: 10.27410/d.cnki.gxbfu.2020.000640", uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/N7X8SLVK"], itemData:{id:3855, type:"article-journal", abstract:"\u5728\u54CD\u5E94\u8054\u5408\u56FD\"\u79EF\u6781\u8001\u9F84\u5316\"\u653F\u7B56\u4E0B,\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u518D\u6B21\u53C2\u4E0E\u793E\u4F1A,\u4E30\u5BCC\u5176\u7269\u8D28\u751F\u6D3B\u3001\u6587\u5316\u751F\u6D3B\u3001\u7CBE\u795E\u751F\u6D3B\u5DF2\u7ECF\u6210\u4E3A\u4EBA\u4EEC\u7684\u7684\u5173\u6CE8\u91CD\u70B9\u3002\u672C\u6587\u4ECE\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u4E3A\u51FA\u53D1\u70B9,\u5EF6\u4F38\u5230\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u533A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u60C5\u51B5\u8C03\u67E5,\u901A\u8FC7\u8D70\u8BBF\u5BF9\u4E0A\u6D77\u5E02\u5B9D\u5C71\u533A\u6708\u6D66\u8857\u9053\u3001\u95F5\u884C\u533A\u989B\u6865\u8857\u9053\u3001\u6768\u6D66\u533A\u63A7\u6C5F\u8857\u9053\u7684\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u5BF9\u793E\u4F1A\u6D3B\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u60C5\u51B5\u3001\u4E2A\u4EBA\u60F3\u6CD5\u548C\u610F\u613F\u8FDB\u884C\u8C03\u67E5,\u8FD0\u7528SPSS\u8F6F\u4EF6\u5BF9\u6240\u641C\u96C6\u7684\u6570\u636E\u8FDB\u884C\u5206\u6790\u5E76\u7ED8\u5236\u8868\u683C,\u53D1\u5C55\u53EF\u4EE5\u4FC3\u8FDB\u6211\u56FD\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u518D\u6B21\u4ECB\u5165\u793E\u4F1A\u548C\u63D0\u9AD8\u793E\u533A\u6D3B\u52A8\u7B49\u7684\u957F\u8FDC\u9053\u8DEF\u3002\u4ECE\u653F\u5E9C\u3001\u793E\u533A\u3001\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7B49\u591A\u65B9\u9762\u5165\u624B,\u5EFA\u8BBE\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u79EF\u6781\u53C2\u4E0E\u793E\u4F1A\u7684\u53EF\u6301\u7EED\u53D1\u5C55\u9053\u8DEF\u3002", 'collection-title':"\u65E0", 'container-title':"\u52B3\u52A8\u4FDD\u969C\u4E16\u754C", ISSN:"1007-7243", issue:"17", journalAbbreviation:"\u52B3\u52A8\u4FDD\u969C\u4E16\u754C", language:"zh-CN", note:"KerkoCite.ItemAlsoKnownAs: 9278983:AJBH6ENM 9278983:N7X8SLVK", page:"16-17", source:"CNKI", title:"\u79EF\u6781\u8001\u9F84\u5316\u80CC\u666F\u4E0B\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u8C03\u67E5\u7814\u7A76\u2014\u2014\u4EE5\u4E0A\u6D77\u5E02\u4E3A\u4F8B", author:[{literal:"\u9AD8\u7545\u7545"}, {literal:"\u80E1\u8431\u5A77"}, {literal:"\u5B59\u6C81\u6D0B"}], issued:{'date-parts':[["2018"]]}}}, {id:5854, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/D5487S8R"], itemData:{id:5854, type:"thesis", abstract:"At present,the aging of population has become a major problem in the world.China is the country with the largest population,the population aging phenomenon is undoubtedly worthy of attention,especially in the undeveloped economy,the old-age security system is not perfect in the case in the aging of the population,is bound to China\u2019s economic and social fields impact.On February 2016,general secretary Xi Jinping made important instructions,to strengthen the aging work,and stressed that the aging population is related to the overall situation of national development,to actively respond effectively,relates to the well-being of millions of people.Under the current situation of aging population,how to deal with the problem scientifically and effectively,especially how to change the burden of old people into demographic dividend,is a problem worth thinking deeply under the impact of the silver age wave.In September 6,2016,Yin Weimin,Minister of human resources and social security,said that China would develop human resources for the elderly.This policy is mainly aimed at the problem of reality,China\u2019s labor supply and the declining trend of aging deepening,China\u2019s elderly population,aging fast,\"old before rich\" phenomenon is serious,from the current basic situation of our country,whether it is from the technology,experience,or the degree of physical health,our country has been the development of elderly human resource conditions,the development of elderly human resource development is imperative,if used properly,can form second demographic dividend.This group of retired college teachers as the human resources of the old elite in the community especially precious and scarce,they all have rich knowledge and skills,and to develop human resources for the elderly,let their retirement continue to participate in school work,not only is the importance of talent,and will have a huge role in promoting the development of school and society.Based on the definition of retired teachers,human resources and the concept of human resources re-development of retired teachers in colleges and universities,this study makes in-depth interviews with retired teachers in colleges and universities,and analyzes the results of the interviews,and finds out the impact of retraining teachers\u2019 human resources development model,put forward the research hypothesis,and according to the analysis results and hypothesis design research questionnaire,through the empirical study of the questionnaire,concluded that:college retired teachers personal factors in the physical condition,self-ability,self-demand,family factors in the family Economic status,family attitude,social factors in the policy support,channels and opportunities,the pressure of public opinion and college retired teachers are willing to work independently related.Physical condition,family economic situation,family attitude,public opinion pressure and so on are the important factors that affect the individual willingness of retired teachers in colleges and universities.In view of the factors that the retired teachers of the university continue to participate in the individual wishes of the work,combined with the existing literature research and the existing policy system,and makes full development and utilization of the special human resources of retired teachers in colleges and universities.Effective countermeasures and suggestions to enhance the willingness of retired teachers in their own work,so that more retired teachers can give full play to their own advantages,to achieve the value of self-life.", genre:"\u7855\u58EB", language:"zh-CN", publisher:"\u6D59\u6C5F\u5DE5\u4E1A\u5927\u5B66", source:"CNKI", 'container-title':"\u897F\u5357\u4EA4\u901A\u5927\u5B66\u5B66\u62A5(\u793E\u4F1A\u79D1\u5B66\u7248)", ISSN:"1009-4474", issue:"3", language:"zh-CN", page:"82-92", source:"CNKI", title:"\u5B50\u5973\u4EE3\u9645\u652F\u6301\u4E0E\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u5FC3\u7406\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u5173\u7CFB:\u81EA\u6211\u8001\u5316\u6001\u5EA6\u548C\u793E\u4F1A\u6D3B\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u4E2D\u4ECB\u4F5C\u7528", 'title-short':"\u5B50\u5973\u4EE3\u9645\u652F\u6301\u4E0E\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u5FC3\u7406\u5065\u5EB7\u7684\u5173\u7CFB", volume:"22", author:[{literal:"\u738B\u594E"}, {literal:"\u674E\u542F\u660E"}], issued:{'date-parts':[["2021"]]}}}, {id:7950, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/2UH9ECPE"], itemData:{id:7950, type:"article-journal", abstract:"&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Social engagement has many benefits for health of older adults. The literature describes that personal and environmental factors may act as facilitators or obstacles for levels of social participation of older people. The objective of this systematic review was to examine social participation types most engaged among older people and to analyze factors influencing the social participation of these people. Published articles written in English from 2006 to 2016 were searched from electronic databases, including ScienceDirect, PubMed, and CINAHL databases. The keywords combination used in the search strategy were: social participation, social engagement, social activity, and factors, and aging, or older persons. Ten articles were selected for final review based on defined eligibility criteria.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The literature revealed that community-based activities were more engaged by older people than individual-based activities. In addition, factors influencing participation in social of older people were health status, and a friendly environment, whereas it was still unclear whether sociodemographic factors were correlated with participation in social of older people. The literature highlighted that more rigorous studies are needed to examine the correlation between factors and social participation of older people. Nurses need to work with others to support and educate significant people regarding friendly environments for older people so that they can engage in social activities, either community- based or individual-based.", 'container-title':"Pacific Rim International Journal of Nursing Research", ISSN:"2586-8373", issue:"2", language:"en-US", license:"Copyright (c) 2019 Pacific Rim International Journal of Nursing Research", note:"number: 2", page:"131-141", source:"he02.tci-thaijo.org", title:"A Systematic Review of Factors Influencing Social Participation of Older Adults", (3)(+0000009): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"eMch1Kkv", properties:{formattedCitation:"(Utz et al., 2002)", plainCitation:"(Utz et al., 2002)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:8133, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/MU6RM69Z"], itemData:{id:8133, type:"article-journal", abstract:"PURPOSE: This study evaluated how levels of social participation change as a result of late-life widowhood. Social participation is a multidimensional construct incorporating both formal (e.g., meeting attendance, religious participation, and volunteer obligations) and informal (e.g., telephone contact and social interactions with friends) social roles.\nDESIGN AND METHODS: Using data from the Changing Lives of Older Couples study, analyses compared widowed persons to continuously married control participants to evaluate whether widowhood affects older adults' levels of social participation.\nRESULTS: Widowed persons had higher levels of informal social participation than nonwidowed persons, whereas formal social participation levels were comparable between the two groups. Social participation levels decrease before the death of a spouse, primarily because of poor spousal health, and increase following the loss, because of increased support from friends and relatives.\nIMPLICATIONS: Maintaining continuity in the realm of social participation is a strategy older adults use to cope with spousal loss; however, not all widowed persons have the same resources to alter their levels of social participation.", archive_location:"344 citation(s)", 'container-title':"The Gerontologist", DOI:"10.1093/geront/42.4.522", ISSN:"0016-9013", issue:"4", journalAbbreviation:"Gerontologist", language:"en-US", note:"PMID: 12145380", page:"522-533", source:"PubMed", title:"The effect of widowhood on older adults' social participation: an evaluation of activity, disengagement, and continuity theories", (3)(+0000022): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"r3OWWOmW", properties:{formattedCitation:"(\\uc0\\u29579{}\\uc0\\u33395{}\\uc0\\u33459{}, 2020; \\uc0\\u35874{}\\uc0\\u31435{}\\uc0\\u40654{}, \\uc0\\u27754{}\\uc0\\u25996{}, 2019; \\uc0\\u39532{}\\uc0\\u23068{}, 2019)", plainCitation:"(\u738B\u8273\u82B3, 2020; \u8C22\u7ACB\u9ECE, \u6C6A\u658C, 2019; \u9A6C\u5A1C, 2019)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:5881, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/YDBYJCT2"], itemData:{id:5881, type:"thesis", abstract:"Under the premise of the rapid development of socio-economic level,people\u2019s quality of life has been significantly improved,life expectancy has been continuously prolonged,the proportion of the elderly population has risen,the number of working-age population has relatively decreased,and the dependency ratio of the elderly population has increased.The social burden tends to accentuate,the pension supply power drops continuously,these problems all have a great impact on the existing pension system.The World Health Organization\uFF08WHO\uFF09has put forward the concept of \"positive ageing\" as early as the millennium to deal with the problems of this century.On the one hand,the 60-69 years,many of them are not only healthy but also has rich work experience,social resources and has very strong attachment psychology,the possibility of re-employment is greater.On the other hand,the number of human resources of the young aged population in China is huge,and it has its unique advantages in professional skills,life experience and work experience.Thus,promoting the re-employment of the young can help to make sense for the elderly,in order to relieve the pressure of labor shortage.At present,the theoretical research and practical experience about the re-employment of the young elderly in our country are relatively lacking,especially in the aspects of social concept,policy support and so on.Based on the questionnaire survey of five communities in Lanzhou and the statistical data of Lanzhou Bureau of Statistics,this paper is supported by the theory of positive aging,the theory of human capital and the theory of employment.The logistic binary regression analysis is used to explore the difficulties faced by the young elderly in Lanzhou and the degree of influence among the influencing factors,and then draw lessons from the successful experience in the world,and put forward the countermeasures to promote the re-employment of the young elderly in Lanzhou.To actively respond to ageing And can provide a feasible theoretical basis for effectively configuring the force resources of the low-age old people.", genre:"\u7855\u58EB", language:"zh-CN", note:"DOI: uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/JTYZVVL2"], itemData:{id:5902, type:"thesis", abstract:"With the continuous development of China\u2019s economy and the continuous improvement of medical technology,the population mortality rate has been greatly reduced,the number of the elderly population in China has been rising,and the aging problem has shown an increasingly severe situation.As early as the millennium,the World Health Organization has put forward the concept of \"active aging\" to deal with the challenges of this century.The report of the Nineteenth National Congress of the Party also pointed out that we should actively deal with the aging of the population and improve the life satisfaction and happiness of the elderly groups.Encouraging and promoting the social participation of older persons is one of the effective ways to achieve their \"active ageing\" goals,through which older persons can have a greater sense of acquisition,happiness and security and make their retirement life more fulfilling,secure and sustainable.As a special group of the elderly,retired teachers in colleges and universities have their own unique value and advantages over the retired elderly in other industries.Active social participation is conducive to alleviating the contradiction between talent supply and demand;at the same time,it also brings great benefits to the elderly themselves,so that the elderly through the channel of social participation,give full play to their professional expertise,while contributing to the society,but also can achieve their own inner pursuit of a better life.This paper mainly focuses on the main line of social participation of retired teachers in colleges and universities,taking retired teachers in several colleges and universities in Anning District of Lanzhou City as the research object,through drawing on the theory of active aging and activity theory,combining with the characteristics of retired teachers\u2019 own social participation,with the help of questionnaire survey,literature research,statistical analysis and other methods to carry out empirical research on the social participation of retired teachers in colleges and universities in Anning District of Lanzhou City.It is found that there are a series of problems in the social participation of retired teachers in colleges and universities,such as imperfect legal mechanism,insufficient participation platform and low participation level.Based on this,this paper puts forward some countermeasures and suggestions on the socialparticipation of retired teachers in Anning District of Lanzhou City from different perspectives.In order to actively deal with aging,enhance the well-being of the elderly group,sense of acquisition,security to (3)(+0000049): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"RYUZHy0a", properties:{formattedCitation:"(Gr\\uc0\\u252{}nwald et al., 2021)", plainCitation:"(Gr\xFCnwald et al., 2021)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:2107, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/6GYP4EIL"], itemData:{id:2107, type:"article-journal", abstract:"OBJECTIVES: Research on retirees' engagement in informal caregiving, formal volunteering, and grandparenting often views retirement as a permanent exit from the workforce. Retirement processes are, however, increasingly diverse: some retire fully while others remain in paid work after retirement from a career job. A relevant but understudied question is how these different retirement processes relate to changes in engagement in unpaid productive activities. Building on role theory, we hypothesize that full and working retirees face different consequences of retirement and, therefore, differ in engagement in unpaid productive activities.\nMETHOD: We analyze data that were collected in 2015 and 2018 among 4,882 Dutch individuals aged 60-65 and employed at baseline. Around half had fully retired at follow-up and 10% worked after their retirement. At follow-up, more respondents are regularly volunteering (from 17% to 27%) and grandparenting (from 39% to 53%) than at baseline, while caregiving remains rather stable (from 33% to 30%).\nRESULTS: Conditional change models show that full retirement is associated with an increased likelihood of volunteering and grandparenting, but not caregiving. Engagement in postretirement work is related to an increased likelihood of looking after the grandchildren, but not to volunteering or providing informal care.\nDISCUSSION: Our findings suggest that volunteering is important for replacing weak ties after full retirement, while grandparenting might be a new, central role in retirement-irrespective of work engagement. Retirees seem to engage in unpaid productive activities for different reasons.", 'container-title':"The Journals of Gerontology. 33294930\nPMCID: PMC8611689", page:"607-619", source:"PubMed", title:"The Differential Impact of Retirement on Informal Caregiving, Volunteering, and Grandparenting: Results of a 3-Year Panel Study", (3)(+0000026): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"Um3ArvNF", properties:{formattedCitation:"(Portegijs et al., 2017; \\uc0\\u20522{}\\uc0\\u24314{}\\uc0\\u26149{}, \\uc0\\u26041{}\\uc0\\u33021{}, 2021; \\uc0\\u26446{}\\uc0\\u24605{}\\uc0\\u23431{}, 2019; \\uc0\\u27573{}\\uc0\\u26690{}\\uc0\\u33395{}, 2012)", plainCitation:"(Portegijs et al., 2017; \u502A\u5EFA\u6625, \u65B9\u80FD, 2021; \u674E\u601D\u5B87, 2019; \u6BB5\u6842\u8273, 2012)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:4561, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/N2334SQ5"], itemData:{id:4561, type:"thesis", abstract:"Aging Population is an irreversible trend. With the active aging concept, the social participation of the elderly is gradually concerned by the academia and the government. This study is based on this background and pays attention to the social participation of the urban elderly. This study specifically pays attention to the urban elderly social participation status, the main factors that affect the urban elderly social participation. This is of great significance to promote the social participation of the elderly and improve the life quality of the elderly.This study\u2019s research objects are Beijing60aged and over, the writer uses systematic random sampling method to collect data by conducting a questionnaire survey in Anhui Li community in the Chaoyang District, Beijing Asian Games Village street. The survey sample contains472elderly people, the writer gets a total of400questionnaires finally, of which306valid questionnaires, the questionnaire response rate is75%.In this study, the concept of social participation is operated into cultural and sports activities, the political activities and the volunteer activities. The measure indexes of cultural and sports activities include13activities, such as playing chess; The measure indexes of political activities include4activities, such as participating in the community\u2019s neighborhood committee and council activities; The measure indexes of volunteer activities include4activities, such as donating money and other things. The participation frequency of each activity is set to \"every day\",\"often\" and \"sometimes\",\"occasionally\" and \"never\". Firstly, the study reflects the social participation status of the old of Anhui Li community from the frequency and scale; and the influence factors on the status of the elderly are followed using multiple regression analysis.The study finds that from the frequency of the elderly social participation, walking/using equipment and chat gatherings have the highest frequency in the cultural and sports activities; neighborhood council has the highest frequency in the political activities; donating money has the highest frequency in the volunteer activities. At the same time, the overall social participation frequency is very low, the three types of activities range from \"never\" and \"occasional\". From the breadth of the elderly social participation, the number of older with breadth1-5is largest in the cultural and sports activities; the number of older with breadth0is most in the political activities; the number of older with breadth1is largest in the volunteer activities.The elderly social participation is an important thing involving the elderly, the elderly family and the community environment. It has nothing with the age, but health. A good health is the foundation of any activity for the elderly. From the data analysis results, the elderly who think they have the better self-rated health status and have a self-assessment outgoing character have calm state of mind and a healthy and do not exclude themselves from the crowd, and are willing to participate in all activities. Length of residence in this community has also become an important factor of the elderly social participation. Length of residence has close contact with a sense of community, the elderly who have a longer residence time are more familiar with this community and don\u2019t rule out activities in the community. However, living in a shorter time especially the elderly who stay less than five years, of which come to Beijing due to their children or other reasons, their social participation degree is very low. They rarely participate in community\u2019s cultural entertainment, political activities and volunteer activities with a very narrow range of the scope of activities and exchanges, a low integration of the community. From the community environment, whether the elderly know the activities is the base of their social participation.", genre:"\u7855\u58EB", language:"zh-CN", publisher:"\u4E2D\u592E\u6C11\u65CF\u5927\u5B66", source:"CNKI", title:"\u57CE\u5E02\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u5EA6\u7814\u7A76", URL:"https://oversea.cnki.net/kcms/detail/detail.aspx?filename=1012416325.nh&dbcode=CMFD&dbname=CMFD2012&v=C0JoWLEhhFuYQCnCxCsb7jiPcNSgXdPxwwL5p0j8NF6CrmmAHhSwT1TuNg3p84r_", author:[{literal:"\u6BB5\u6842\u8273"}], contributor:[{literal:"\u827E\u658C"}], accessed:{'date-parts':[["2022", 5, 13]]}, issued:{'date-parts':[["2012"]]}}}, {id:5923, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/6T5ZXQC4"], itemData:{id:5923, type:"thesis", abstract:"With the rapid development of economy and the decline of fertility rate,birth rate as well as death rate,the proportion of elderly population in China is rising.Under the concept of \u201Cactive aging\u201D,all sectors of the community pay more attention to the needs and abilities of the elderly group to participate in the society activities.According to the data from the fourth sample Survey of the living conditions of the elderly in China\u2019s Urban and Rural areas,the social participation of the elderly in our country is constantly increasing currently.However,the social participation rate of the elderly both in recreational activities such as games of chess and cards,reading books and newspapers,and in political activities such as community public affairs,or taking part in voluntary activities are less than 50%.Therefore,an empirical study on the social participation behavior and influencing factors of urban elderly groups is beneficial to improve the actual social participation rate of urban elderly groups and their life satisfaction and quality of life.This study mainly adopts the method of random sampling.In order to to obtain primary data,we conduct a questionnaire survey of 360 old people living in Dadukou District of Chongqing City.First of all,we analyze the social participation behavior of the urban elderly group by descriptive statistics,and then compare the differences of the social participation behavior of the urban elderly group from the three categories of personal characteristics,family status and community status,respectively.Finally,we use the four-classification multiple regression model to conduct the empirical analysis.The results show that:\uFF081\uFF09There are many factors that influence the social participation behavior of the urban elderly group.The following factors have a significant impact on the social participation behavior of the urban elderly groups,including age,education,physical condition,psychological condition,average monthly income,middle age personality,present personality,family atmosphere,whether they need to look after your grandchildren or great-grandchildren or not,whether they need to undertake the main housework or not,whether the community infrastructure is perfect and complete or not,and whether the community organize regular activities or not.\uFF082\uFF09There are three main problems in the social participation behavior of the urban elderly groups at present.The elderly themselves lack correct understanding and social participation ability.Care for the family wholeheartedly,lack of self-space.The community organizations are poor managed and the infrastructure is inadequate.According to the above conclusions,this paper puts forward the relevant recommendations from the three levels such as individual,family,community:\uFF081\uFF09The elderly shall establish correct cognition,and strive to improve the ability to participate the society activities.\uFF082\uFF09Give the elderly self-space and encourage them to go out of the family.\uFF083\uFF09Strengthen community construction and providing the elderly a platform for social participation.", genre:"\u7855\u58EB", language:"zh-CN", note:"DOI: 10.27731/d.cnki.ggzcj.2019.000195", publisher:"\u8D35\u5DDE\u8D22\u7ECF\u5927\u5B66", source:"CNKI", title:"\u57CE\u5E02\u8001\u5E74\u7FA4\u4F53\u7684\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u884C\u4E3A\u53CA\u5F71\u54CD\u56E0\u7D20\u7814\u7A76", (3)(+0000067): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"87YFhU6R", properties:{formattedCitation:"(\\uc0\\u26446{}\\uc0\\u24605{}\\uc0\\u23431{}, 2019; \\uc0\\u26612{}\\uc0\\u24935{}\\uc0\\u29723{}, 2013)", plainCitation:"(\u674E\u601D\u5B87, 2019; \u67F4\u6167\u741B, 2013)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:7993, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/SA2B9MKD"], itemData:{id:7993, type:"thesis", abstract:"\u968F\u7740\u4EBA\u53E3\u8001\u9F84\u5316\u95EE\u9898\u7684\u4E0D\u65AD\u52A0\u5267,\u6211\u56FD\u57CE\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u53E3\u4E5F\u5728\u6025\u5267\u589E\u591A,\u57CE\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u5DF2\u7ECF\u6210\u4E3A\u6211\u56FD\u4E00\u4E2A\u4E0D\u5BB9\u5FFD\u89C6\u7684\u793E\u4F1A\u7FA4\u4F53\u3002\u7531\u4E8E\u793E\u4F1A\u804C\u4E1A\u89D2\u8272\u3001\u751F\u6D3B\u73AF\u5883\u3001\u4EBA\u9645\u4EA4\u5F80\u53D1\u751F\u7684\u53D8\u5316,\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u4EBA\u5F80\u5F80\u4F1A\u51FA\u73B0\u5404\u79CD\u9002\u5E94\u6027\u96BE\u9898\u3002\u4ED6\u4EEC\u80FD\u5426\u6BD4\u8F83\u5FEB\u5730\u9002\u5E94\u9000\u4F11\u751F\u6D3B\u3001\u80FD\u5426\u8FC5\u901F\u5B9E\u73B0\u793E\u4F1A\u89D2\u8272\u7684\u8F6C\u6362\u3001\u80FD\u5426\u91CD\u65B0\u878D\u5165\u57CE\u5E02\u793E\u4F1A\u662F\u5173\u7CFB\u6BCF\u4E00\u4F4D\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u4EBA\u751F\u5B58\u4E0E\u53D1\u5C55\u7684\u91CD\u5927\u95EE\u9898,\u800C\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u662F\u89E3\u51B3\u57CE\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u6240\u9762\u4E34\u7684\u8FD9\u4E9B\u95EE\u9898\u7684\u4E00\u4E2A\u91CD\u8981\u9014\u5F84\u3002\u56E0\u6B64,\u5BF9\u57CE\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u7814\u7A76,\u53EF\u4EE5\u6E05\u695A\u5730\u4E86\u89E3\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u57FA\u672C\u72B6\u51B5,\u5206\u6790\u5F71\u54CD\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u56E0\u7D20,\u8FDB\u800C\u53EF\u4EE5\u51C6\u786E\u63A2\u8BA8\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u5BF9\u57CE\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u5F71\u54CD,\u56E0\u800C,\u5BF9\u57CE\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u7814\u7A76\u5177\u6709\u5F88\u5F3A\u7684\u7406\u8BBA\u548C\u73B0\u5B9E\u610F\u4E49\u3002\u672C\u7814\u7A76\u4ECE\u6D3B\u52A8\u7406\u8BBA\u548C\u79EF\u6781\u8001\u9F84\u5316\u7406\u8BBA\u89C6\u89D2\u5C55\u5F00\u8BBA\u8FF0,\u8FD0\u7528\u8D28\u6027\u7814\u7A76\u7684\u7814\u7A76\u65B9\u6CD5,\u5BF9\u5C71\u4E1C\u7701\u6D4E\u5357\u5E02Q\u793E\u533A\u768415\u4F4D\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u8FDB\u884C\u6DF1\u5EA6\u8BBF\u8C08,\u8C03\u67E5\u4ED6\u4EEC\u7684\u4E2A\u4EBA\u57FA\u672C\u60C5\u51B5\u3001\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u72B6\u51B5,\u8FDB\u800C\u5206\u6790\u5F71\u54CD\u5176\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u56E0\u7D20\u4EE5\u53CA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u5BF9\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u751F\u6D3B\u72B6\u51B5\u7684\u5F71\u54CD\u3002\u901A\u8FC7\u8C03\u67E5\u7814\u7A76\u53D1\u73B0,\u76EE\u524D\u6211\u56FD\u57CE\u5E02\u7EDD\u5927\u591A\u6570\u57CE\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u62E5\u6709\u8F83\u591A\u7684\u7A7A\u95F2\u65F6\u95F4\u548C\u826F\u597D\u7684\u8EAB\u4F53\u6761\u4EF6,\u56E0\u800C\u5177\u5907\u4E86\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u826F\u597D\u6761\u4EF6,\u4F46\u662F\u603B\u4F53\u800C\u8A00,\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u60C5\u51B5\u5E76\u4E0D\u662F\u5F88\u4E50\u89C2,\u4E5F\u5C31\u662F\u8BF4,\u7EDD\u5927\u591A\u6570\u7684\u57CE\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u4EBA\u7684\u95F2\u6687\u751F\u6D3B\u7684\u5B89\u6392\u6CA1\u6210\u7CFB\u7EDF\u6027,\u4ECD\u5904\u4E8E\u81EA\u7531\u5229\u7528\u72B6\u6001,\u4E5F\u5E76\u6CA1\u6709\u79EF\u6781\u4E3B\u52A8\u6295\u5165\u5230\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u4E4B\u4E2D,\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u6C34\u5E73\u8FD8\u6BD4\u8F83\u4F4E\u3002\u7814\u7A76\u8868\u660E,\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u662F\u57CE\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u9002\u5E94\u65B0\u7684\u751F\u6D3B\u73AF\u5883\u7684\u4E00\u79CD\u6709\u6548\u9014\u5F84,\u800C\u5982\u4F55\u63D0\u9AD8\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u5C31\u9700\u8981\u5145\u5206\u53D1\u6325\u653F\u5E9C\u3001\u7EC4\u7EC7\u3001\u793E\u533A\u7684\u4F5C\u7528\u3002\u653F\u5E9C\u65B9\u9762\u5E94\u8BE5\u5B8C\u5584\u76F8\u5E94\u7684\u5236\u5EA6\u548C\u653F\u7B56,\u52A0\u5927\u5BF9\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u8D44\u91D1\u6295\u5165,\u901A\u8FC7\u5B8C\u5584\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u673A\u5236,\u4FDD\u969C\u53C2\u4E0E\u6E20\u9053\u7684\u987A\u7545\uFF1B\u793E\u4F1A\u5E94\u8BE5\u7A81\u7834\u4F20\u7EDF\u89C2\u5FF5\u7684\u9650\u5236,\u91CD\u89C6\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u4EF7\u503C\u3002\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u4E0D\u4EC5\u9700\u8981\u201C\u6709\u6240\u533B\u201D\u201C\u6709\u6240\u517B\u201D\u66F4\u9700\u8981\u201C\u6709\u6240\u4E3A\u201D\u201C\u6709\u6240\u4E50\u201D,\u624D\u80FD\u786E\u4FDD\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u79EF\u6781\u4E3B\u52A8\u53C2\u4E0E,\u624D\u80FD\u4FDD\u8BC1\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u8D28\u91CF\u7684\u63D0\u9AD8\uFF1B\u793E\u533A\u65B9\u9762,\u5E94\u8BE5\u6539\u5584\u793E\u533A\u73AF\u5883,\u63A8\u8FDB\u793E\u533A\u5EFA\u8BBE,\u4E3A\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u642D\u5EFA\u5404\u79CD\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u7684\u5E73\u53F0,\u5E76\u6839\u636E\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u5174\u8DA3\u7231\u597D\u3001\u5065\u5EB7\u72B6\u51B5\u548C\u53D7\u6559\u80B2\u7A0B\u5EA6\u6709\u9488\u5BF9\u6027\u5730\u5F00\u5C55\u5404\u9879\u6D3B\u52A8\uFF1B\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u81EA\u8EAB\u8981\u8F6C\u53D8\u601D\u60F3\u89C2\u5FF5,\u5BF9\u9000\u4F11\u5E94\u8BE5\u6709\u6B63\u786E\u7684\u8BA4\u8BC6,\u6811\u7ACB\u6B63\u786E\u7684\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u610F\u8BC6,\u540C\u65F6\u5E94\u8BE5\u5584\u4E8E\u5229\u7528\u81EA\u8EAB\u6761\u4EF6,\u79EF\u6781\u53C2\u4E0E\u793E\u4F1A\uFF1B\u6700\u540E,\u4E13\u4E1A\u793E\u4F1A\u5DE5\u4F5C\u8005\u5E94\u8BE5\u534F\u52A9\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u6574\u5408\u8D44\u6E90,\u5E76\u7ED3\u5408\u8001\u5E74\u4EBA\u7684\u9700\u6C42,\u5F00\u5C55\u76F8\u5E94\u7684\u6D3B\u52A8\u3002", genre:"\u7855\u58EB", language:"zh-CN", publisher:"\u5C71\u4E1C\u5927\u5B66", source:"CNKI", title:"\u57CE\u5E02\u9000\u4F11\u8001\u4EBA\u7684\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u72B6\u51B5\u53CA\u5F71\u54CD\u56E0\u7D20\u7814\u7A76", URL:"https://chn.oversea.cnki.net/kcms/detail/detail.aspx?dbcode=CMFD&dbname=CMFD201302&filename=1013220257.nh&uniplatform=NZKPT&v=gtluOqL4vfBhZ1RK2V9NFtrWF_TCeLLzse40C5mBa8HTWmejkjmEGhRtlfqrD0-C", author:[{literal:"\u67F4\u6167\u741B"}], contributor:[{literal:"\u7A0B\u80DC\u5229"}], accessed:{'date-parts':[["2022", 6, 22]]}, issued:{'date-parts':[["2013"]]}}}, {id:5923, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/6T5ZXQC4"], itemData:{id:5923, type:"thesis", abstract:"With the rapid development of economy and the decline of fertility rate,birth rate as well as death rate,the proportion of elderly population in China is rising.Under the concept of \u201Cactive aging\u201D,all sectors of the community pay more attention to the needs and abilities of the elderly group to participate in the society activities.According to the data from the fourth sample Survey of the living conditions of the elderly in China\u2019s Urban and Rural areas,the social participation of the elderly in our country is constantly increasing currently.However,the social participation rate of the elderly both in recreational activities such as games of chess and cards,reading books and newspapers,and in political activities such as community public affairs,or taking part in voluntary activities are less than 50%.Therefore,an empirical study on the social participation behavior and influencing factors of urban elderly groups is beneficial to improve the actual social participation rate of urban elderly groups and their life satisfaction and quality of life.This study mainly adopts the method of random sampling.In order to to obtain primary data,we conduct a questionnaire survey of 360 old people living in Dadukou District of Chongqing City.First of all,we analyze the social participation behavior of the urban elderly group by descriptive statistics,and then compare the differences of the social participation behavior of the urban elderly group from the three categories of personal characteristics,family status and community status,respectively.Finally,we use the four-classification multiple regression model to conduct the empirical analysis.The results show that:\uFF081\uFF09There are many factors that influence the social participation behavior of the urban elderly group.The following factors have a significant impact on the social participation behavior of the urban elderly groups,including age,education,physical condition,psychological condition,average monthly income,middle age personality,present personality,family atmosphere,whether they need to look after your grandchildren or great-grandchildren or not,whether they need to undertake the main housework or not,whether the community infrastructure is perfect and complete or not,and whether the community organize regular activities or not.\uFF082\uFF09There are three main problems in the social participation behavior of the urban elderly groups at present.The elderly themselves lack correct understanding and social participation ability.Care for the family wholeheartedly,lack of self-space.The community organizations are poor managed and the infrastructure is inadequate.According to the above conclusions,this paper puts forward the relevant recommendations from the three levels such as individual,family,community:\uFF081\uFF09The elderly shall establish correct cognition,and strive to improve the ability to participate the society activities.\uFF082\uFF09Give the elderly self-space and encourage them to go out of the family.\uFF083\uFF09Strengthen community construction and providing the elderly a platform for social participation.", genre:"\u7855\u58EB", language:"zh-CN", note:"DOI: 10.27731/d.cnki.ggzcj.2019.000195", publisher:"\u8D35\u5DDE\u8D22\u7ECF\u5927\u5B66", source:"CNKI", title:"\u57CE\u5E02\u8001\u5E74\u7FA4\u4F53\u7684\u793E\u4F1A\u53C2\u4E0E\u884C\u4E3A\u53CA\u5F71\u54CD\u56E0\u7D20\u7814\u7A76", URL:"https://oversea.cnki.net/kcms/detail/detail.aspx?dbcode=CMFD&dbname=CMFD202001&filename=1019253705.nh&uniplatform=NZKPT&v=ho0PzMKKDweSpyhFNkzHuKkccXtGd-JMQxl8AOieDWoFn6lRfvOoojtyNDgsCmn1", author:[{literal:"\u674E\u601D\u5B87"}], contributor:[{literal:"\u97E6\u749E"}], accessed:{'date-parts':[["2022", 5, 26]]}, issued:{'date-parts':[["2019"]]}}}], (3)(+0000026): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"laFbIctV", properties:{formattedCitation:"(2012)", plainCitation:"(2012)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:546, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/5VIZ8LQR"], itemData:{id:546, type:"thesis", abstract:"Using a retirement arrangement does not necessarily mean that people retire fulltime. The phenomenon of bridge employment, already studied in the US, becomes increasingly popular among older adults in the Netherlands. The question is to what extent bridge employment can be beneficial for well-being of older adults during the retirement process, especially for older workers who are confronted with involuntary retirement. It is often noted that involuntary retirement is detrimental for well-being. However, it can be presumed that having a bridge job after this negative event can buffer the negative consequences for well-being. Multilevel longitudinal random intercept models and fixed effects models on the \u2018NIDI Work and Retirement Panel\u2019 data show that well-being is lower for people who experienced their retirement as forced. However, forced retirees who regained control over the retirement process by taking a bridge job do not seem to have lower levels of well-being compared to workers still in their main career job. KEYWORDS: subjective well-being \u25AA bridge employment \u25AA involuntary retirement \u25AA multilevel longitudinal models", genre:"Master\u2019s thesis", language:"en-US", publisher:"Tilburg (3)(+0000013): Integration: style.processCitationCluster(({citationID:"BrPo42QG", properties:{formattedCitation:"(2019)", plainCitation:"(2019)", noteIndex:0}, citationItems:[{id:1202, uris:["http://zotero.org/users/9278983/items/SNT2QUMI"], itemData:{id:1202, type:"article-journal", abstract:"Much research has sought to understand how people construct their careers; however, only little is known about the career construction of older workers. To understand how people construct their careers in later life, we take a lifespan development perspective on career construction theory. Specifically, we propose and test a model in which we take a closer look at older workers\u2019 career adaptability and aging experience (i.e., physical loss, social loss, personal growth, and gaining self-knowledge) as relevant factors shaping their late career planning. Moreover, we explore whether these relationships are mediated by older workers\u2019 occupational future time perspective as an important underlying mechanism between adaptability resources (i.e., career adaptability), experiences (i.e., aging experience), and adapting responses (i.e., late career planning). We test our model with two-wave longitudinal data from a sample of older workers (aged 50 to 79) based in the United Kingdom. Results show that occupational future time perspective mediated the positive effects of career adaptability and personal growth, as well as the negative effect of physical loss on late career planning. Overall, our findings contribute to a better understanding of late career construction and offers practical implications for older workers to purse activities that help them to successfully plan their late career.", 'container-title':"Journal of Vocational Behavior", DOI:"10.1016/j.jvb.2018.10.006", ISSN:"00018791", journalAbbreviation:"Journal of Vocational Behavior", language:"en-US", page:"24-38", source:"DOI.org (Crossref)", title:"Is the future still open?
